Add the shrimp drop-wise to each of your Hydra tanks, making sure to disperse them throughout the tank. Add as much as the Hydra can consume with little excess. Excess shrimp can contribute to fouling. Getting the quantity right will take some practice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22t8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"84oau","text":"After Hydra eat, it will take 6-8 hours for them to regurgitate pellets of undigested material. A good schedule is to feed your Hydra in the morning and clean their tanks in the afternoon before you leave for the day. You will remove both uneaten shrimp and pellets at the same time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1hqnt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gpcu","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eamer","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"96tfp","text":"If you have observed poor health of your Hydra or fouling in the tanks, you might want to clean twice on each feeding day - once 30 minutes after feeding to remove uneaten shrimp, and once in the afternoon to remove pellets.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ci9bp","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"90iuv","text":"Hydra tanks do not have to be perfectly clean. Remember, Hydra's natural environment is a pond, so a sterile environment may not be ideal.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9uun5","text":"If you are using a sieve, just set the sieve with the brine shrimp into the dish of Hydra medium. If you're using a net, turn the net inside out and submerge the brine shrimp in the dish of Hydra medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1o7fm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9s60r","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"57efe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9C21A070091711ECB99BB5F92D2CBB3F","height":184,"id":210121,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2jj41","text":"Brine shrimp in a sieve suspended in Hydra medium.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/jpeg","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"IMG_0154-2.jpg","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gpgmber8x.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gpgjber8x.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gpgkber8x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gpgiber8x.webp","width":221}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"anjh5","text":"Clean up: Empty the hatchery, scrub it under tap water, rinse with DI water and spray it with ethanol to sterilize. Rinse the net and plastic tube with DI water and sterilize with ethanol.  Leave the net, hatchery, and plastic tube on the bench for the ethanol to evaporate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7l5j2","text":"With a rubber glove on your hand, use your finger to scrape the Hydra off the surface of the tank until they are floating loose in the medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"an6d","text":"Pour the contents of the tank into your glass bowl and swirl to collect the Hydra in the center of the bowl (see Step 8.3 above).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dprp3","text":"Wash the dirty tank by scrubbing with a brush under tap water. Rinse with DI water then spray with ethanol. If you are going to add Hydra directly back into the tank, wipe with a paper towel to remove residual ethanol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"73fjf","text":"As you are feeding and cleaning your Hydra, keep an eye out for any changes in the appearance of the animals that might indicate a decline in health. Make sure to examine your Hydra once per week under a dissecting microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"senc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eiq4","text":"Things to look for:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a9ekm","text":"Tentacles look short and pointy.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjrgf","text":"Hydra are contracted and dont extend when left to rest.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ncio","text":"There is an excessive amount of debris accumulating on the surface of the tank.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"52u6n","text":"Hydra look like they are wearing fuzzy sweaters. This is a sign of a bacterial infection. Hydra normally have colonies of bacteria that live on their feet but sometimes the bacteria can start colonizing other parts of the animals. Usually this requires antibiotic treatment (see protocol below).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2obeo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"45j47","text":"See Figure 2 from Bossert \u0026 Galliot (2021) for a detailed description of the stages of Hydra health degeneration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b0lr7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"47sbk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"authors":"Bossert P, Galliot B","can_edit":1,"date":"1325376000","doi":"","guid":"9F2D1360FB7C11EBA00763A61A678F12","id":1338,"journal":"The International journal of developmental biology","protocol_id":"0","title":"How to use Hydra as a model system to teach biology in the classroom"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6hgs","text":"Clean your tanks after every feeding:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":37}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51kf1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3unuq","text":"Clean Hydra tanks to remove uneaten shrimp and regurgitated pellets on the same day that you feed your Hydra. While cleaning, take note of any changes to the health of your Hydra and the accumulating debris in the tanks that might indicate that it's time for a full cleaning (see below).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1n1ds","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1rm7c","text":"Materials:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dq7bt","text":"Hydra medium","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2l3q9","text":"Large glass bowl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jb5","text":"Pasteur pipettes and bulbs","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qejr","text":"Fill a clean tank halfway with Hydra medium. Use a Pasteur pipette to transfer the Hydra back into the tank, being careful to avoid any debris.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2o0r","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7ha89","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"41p8k","text":"You may need to pipette the Hydra up and down or transfer them to another container with fresh Hydra medium to get all of the debris off them.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1p0pm","text":"Gently swirl the medium in the tank to dislodge uneaten shrimp, pellets, and other debris. Pour the medium out of the  tank into a large glass bowl. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fcts","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"crf3o","text":"Add a little more Hydra medium to the tank, swirl again, and pour into the glass bowl. Replace the Hydra medium in the tank with fresh medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cf3q8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f7o8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7uiqd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4gqqg","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"cd8fs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4k8t3","text":"While dispensing the medium into the tanks, avoid pouring the medium directly on top of the Hydra. Hold the tank at an angle and dispense the medium down the side of the tank.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"83r16","text":"While pouring the medium out of the tank, some Hydra may stick to the side of the tank above the level of the medium. Use the tip of your Pasteur pipette to push the Hydra back into the medium.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7et8m","text":"It's likely that many Hydra were poured off along with the debris into the glass bowl. If there are only a few, or you have enough remaining in your tanks, you can discard the ones you've poured off.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3gr6u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"abp24","text":"If you want to recover these Hydra, a convenient method is to gently swirl the medium in the glass dish then set the dish on your bench until it stops swirling. {"blocks":[{"key":"44gt2","text":"Prepare rifampicin stock:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e68d9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ugb9","text":"Prepare    rifampicin stock solution in DMSO by adding the DMSO directly to the bottle of rifampicin.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7fqqq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ube8","text":"For example, if you have a    bottle of rifampicin powder, add    of DMSO.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":27,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":63,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fpu1j","text":"Cap the bottle and invert it a few times to make sure all rifampicin in the bottle is dissolved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"50","error_concentration":false,"guid":"E452DF20FB9411EBA4C6476E0C4F76BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":204}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"2AA298D0FB9511EBA4C6476E0C4F76BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":6}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"4DA267C0FB9511EBA4C6476E0C4F76BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":80,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ak73l","text":"Dilute the rifampicin stock 1:1000 in Hydra medium for a final concentration of 50 g/mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"73uc8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"amsnr","text":"For example, to make  , add   rifampicin stock to   Hydra medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":21,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":28,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":50,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f1oeo","text":"Store medium with rifampicin in the dark.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6f747","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"","data":{"concentration":"50","error_concentration":false,"guid":"3C609EE0FBF011EBA00763A61A678F12","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":204}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A04BCB00FB9611EBA4C6476E0C4F76BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"EFC0D3B0FB9611EBA4C6476E0C4F76BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"FB3E6A90FB9611EBA4C6476E0C4F76BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"4":{"type":"amount","mutability":"","data":{"amount":"999","error":false,"guid":"2E4417A0FB9711EBA4C6476E0C4F76BC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a700l","text":"Treat infected Hydra:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ev9f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4cuhj","text":"Use Hydra medium with rifampicin in place of regular Hydra medium. {"blocks":[{"key":"cnds2","text":"Pour discarded Hydra medium into a bottle or beaker and treat with 10% bleach for 20 minutes before pouring down the drain. This is a precaution against releasing Hydra into the environment, which is especially important when you are working with transgenic lines.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2npsf","text":"When you are out of cysts and need to open a new container, remove the container from the freezer and allow it to come to   overnight. description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bbm97","text":"This is a series of introductory lab activities for BIOL309-03: Research Methods. The purpose is to master vocabulary related to Hydra anatomy, become familiar with compound microscopes and dissecting microscopes, and practice microdissections and micropipette use. The second section sets up a head and tentacle regeneration experiment that will be documented a week later to provide quantitative data for a statistics activity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"15ukv","text":"Microscopes are delicate and expensive instruments. Please handle them with care at all times and follow these guidelines:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2frjd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8vu52","text":"Hold the microscope by its base and carry it with two hands.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7lqcm","text":"Avoid touching any of the optical components.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7md5d","text":"Only clean lenses with a lens paper and lens clearer or DI water.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c4p0s","text":"When you are on high power (20X, 40X, or 100X) only use the fine focus adjustment. On 4X or 10X, you can use the course focus adjustment.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3n06m","text":"Don't adjust any components if you don't know what they do or try to fix anything you don't know how to fix. Alert your instructor if there are any issues with the microscopes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6pbae","text":"When you are done using the microscope turn off the light, move the objective to 4X, and cover it with the dust cover.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"236tv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"984lc","text":"Everyone's eyes are a different distance apart, so it's critical to adjust the distance between the oculars every time you use a microscope that someone else may have used before. If the oculars are too far apart or close together you will see double images or nothing at all.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ckaoh","text":"Anyone who examines a large number of Hydra in a dish can clearly see that they do not all have the same number of tentacles. You may wonder, does each animal have a fixed number of tentacles? If we were to hypothesize that each animal has a fixed number of tentacles, it might follow that we cut a Hydra in half and allowed the foot-end to regenerate a head, this head would have the same number of tentacles as the head that was removed. We will keep the head-end of the Hydra to test whether the number of tentacles on an intact Hydra head spontaneously changes in the course of a Parts of the dissecting microscope, just what you need to know for this activity.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"dissecting microscope.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gp49ber8x.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gp47ber8x.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gp48ber8x.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/gp46ber8x.webp","width":550}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"99t9q","text":"Check your workstation to make sure you have all materials listed above.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6isc1","text":"Fill your Petri dish halfway with Hydra medium. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"dugbh","text":"Use your glass Pasteur pipette to transfer six adult asexual Hydra without buds, one by one, from the common dish to your Petri dish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"djn0n","text":"Set your 100-1000 L adjustable volume micropipette to 1000 L. Get a new tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f8vr2","text":"Fill 12 wells of your 24-well plate with 2 mL (2 X 1000 L) of Hydra medium using your micropipette.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9r9cl","text":"Dispose of used tips in the waste container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9g222","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"67l5b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98je","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"79kld","text":"12-well plates and 6-well plates can also be used, just adjust the volume of medium in each well.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"ajsd0","text":"Two students can share a 24-well plate.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4al1a","text":"Put a piece of labeling tape on the lid of your 24-well plate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"ds6t3","text":"Use a permanent marker to label it with your name and date.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9p141","text":"Place your Petri dish on the stage of your dissecting microscope and turn the light control knob to the \"I\" (incident light) setting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"40l5j","text":"Adjust the zoom to the lowest setting.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"37tec","text":"Adjust the distance between the oculars until you see a single field.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bjlu3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"67qa4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9vrm2","text":"Adjust the focus knob to get a crisp image of one of your Hydra. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cr6lk","text":"Try slowly zooming in on it, adjusting the focus as you go.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhbcv","text":"While doing the dissection, you'll have to find a magnification that works for you.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5hjj6","text":"Count the number of tentacles that the Hydra has and record it in your lab notebook.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5nh50","text":"Since you are going to dissect six Hydra you may want to set up a table to record the following information for each Hydra:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"9k9vs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"5tb26","text":"Initial number of tentacles","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"6fc9u","text":"Well containing head-end","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"35ren","text":"Number of tentacles on head-end after a week","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"bevhq","text":"Well containing foot-end","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"k8vh","text":"Number of tentacles on foot-end after a week","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"blka7","text":"Use your scalpel to cut the Hydra transversely (horizontally) in two. This is called a mid-gastric bisection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ept6v","text":"Try to cut it right above the budding zone. In some adult Hydra, you can see a visible \"bulge\" near the budding zone. If this is not visible, just try to cut it into two equal parts.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4lrph","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"etkvp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"53uhs","text":"Hydra are sometimes elongated and sometimes contracted. They are easiest to cut when they are elongated. If your Hydra is contracted, let it sit undisturbed until it elongates again before trying to make the cut.","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4l834","text":"","type":"unstyled"},{"data":[],"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"1li8u","text":"Sometimes the Hydra will be floating on the surface of the water. Use your scalpel or the tip of your glass pipette to push them down to the bottom of the dish before cutting.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"828m7","text":"What happened to your Hydra right after you cut it?","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8se20","text":"Record any behaviors you observed in your lab notebook. Also record any \"mistakes\" that you make while cutting the Hydra (for example, cutting the same animal twice, or cutting in the wrong place).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"503v5","text":"You should not have a head-end and a foot-end. Transfer both into separate wells of your 24-well plate. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"4h6dc","text":"Record which well the head and foot ends were placed in.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2u263","text":"Repeat steps 11 through 15 for five more Hydra. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cd4vk","text":"When you are done, place the lid on your 24-well plate and give it to your instructor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c0ui3","text":"Turn your microscope off when you're done and cover with the dust cover.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"lu65","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1r3se","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b0jdq","text":"If the number of tentacles is not fixed for an individual Hydra, what factors do you think might effect the number of tentacles?","type":"unstyled"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"b8tjg","text":"Are there any other control groups you think should have been included in this experiment?","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6h5mc","text":"We will allow the Hydra to regenerate for 7 days before counting the number of tentacles on the head and foot-ends. Get you 24-well plate that you used in the previous class session from your instructor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9f98i","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b8su7","text":"Materials:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be8m8","text":"Dissecting microscope","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"83gq7","text":"Your 24-well plate","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ob18","text":"Forceps (optional)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9r1br","text":"With the dissecting microscope, examine the Hydra in each well and record the number of tentacles in the table you started in step 12. If the Hydra are hard to see because they are stuck to the side of the well, you can use the forceps to push them into the center of the well.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ft8e","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2akbj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"fdp5","text":"Working with a partner, you can have one person observe and the other record, then switch roles.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"476r","text":"When you're done, turn off the light on your microscope and cover the microscope with dust cover.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71tbg","text":"We will use the data you have recorded for statistical analysis to determine whether individual Hydra tend to regenerate the same number of tentacles that they had before bisection.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"flltq","text":"Scalpels, microscope slides, and glass Pasteur pipettes should be handled with care. Dispose of used Pasteur pipettes in the broken glass bin and dispose of all blades in the red sharps container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"cl6ir","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]},{"key":"294ie","text":"Do not put any living organisms down the sink. Dispose of all media that comes in contact with Hydra in the \"Hydra Waste\" container.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
